metadata.name: PUA - System Informer Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of System Informer, a task manager tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level operations

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\systeminformer.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('systeminformer.exe') AND lower(device.desc) = lower('system informer') AND lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('system informer') AND (contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('md5=19426363a37c03c3ed6fedf57b6696ec')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('sha1=8b12c6da8fac0d5e8ab999c31e5ea04af32d53dc')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('sha256=8ee9d84de50803545937a63c686822388a3338497cddb660d5d69cf68b68f287')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('imphash=b68908adaeb5d662f87f2528af318f12'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of System Informer, a task manager tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level operations

metadata.objective: False positive: System Informer is regularly used legitimately by system administrators or developers. Apply additional filters accordingly Reference: https://github.com/winsiderss/systeminformer
